meanings.definition: To look at or examine closely
meanings.sent1: She decided to scan the document for any errors.
meanings.sent2: I will scan the map to find the best route.
meanings.sent3: He tried to scan the book with his eyes closed, which was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes scanned the room like a hawk searching for prey.
meanings.sent5: The detective scanned the crime scene for any clues.

meanings.definition: To analyze or search through quickly
meanings.sent1: The teacher will scan the students' essays for plagiarism.
meanings.sent2: I need to scan through the report before the meeting.
meanings.sent3: He tried to scan the entire library in just five minutes, which was impossible.
meanings.sent4: Her mind scanned through memories like flipping through a photo album.
meanings.sent5: The computer program can scan thousands of files in seconds.

meanings.sent1: She gave a quick scan of the room before entering.
meanings.sent2: I took a scan of the menu to decide what to order.
meanings.sent3: His scan of the test questions made him realize he forgot to study.
meanings.sent4: Her scan of the newspaper headlines revealed shocking news.
meanings.sent5: The security guard did a quick scan of everyone entering the building.

meanings.definition: An image or copy obtained by scanning
meanings.sent1: She saved the scan of the document on her computer.
meanings.sent2: I need to make a scan of this photo for the presentation.
meanings.sent3: His scan of the painting turned out blurry, much to his disappointment.
meanings.sent4: The scan of the barcode revealed the product details.
meanings.sent5: The scan of the fingerprint matched the suspect's identity.
